With Rohit turning 40 and Kohli 37 by then, Gavaskar warned that limited international fixtures may not give the veteran duo enough practice. He also hinted their Australia tour availability is influenced by India’s World Cup final loss.

title: Cuttack bandh: 36-hour curfew, internet banned; city on edge - Key points
description: Cuttack witnessed fresh communal tensions and violent clashes on Sunday. Police denied permission for a bike rally, leading to stone pelting and arson. At least 25 people, including eight police personnel, sustained injuries. Authorities imposed a 36-hour curfew and suspended internet services. The chief minister urged peace. The unrest began during a Durga idol immersion procession on Friday night.

title: This IIT will offer an MD first: NMC approval in; MBBS programme paused
description: IIT Kharagpur is set to launch its first MD programme following approval from the National Medical Commission. Clinical training will be conducted at the Syama Prasad Mookerjee Institute of Medical Sciences, with infrastructure expanded for inpatient and surgical care. While the MBBS plan remains on hold due to inadequate facilities, the institute aims to integrate technology-driven medical research in postgraduate education.

title: Jaipur hospital fire: Witnesses recall horror; relatives of patients claim staff fled as smoke spread
description: A devastating fire, caused by a short circuit, erupted in the Trauma ICU of SMS Hospital in Jaipur, leading to chaos and multiple casualties. Hospital staff reportedly fled, leaving panicked relatives to rescue trapped patients amidst thick smoke. The incident tragically resulted in patient deaths and exposed critical safety lapses within the facility.

title: 20-year-old Chinese woman gets kidney disease from dyeing her hair every month

Doctors diagnosed her with kidney inflammation, linking it to dangerous toxins in hair dye that can cause renal failure and increase cancer risk. This case sparked online debate about blindly following celebrity trends and the health dangers of frequent hair color changes.

Interval walking: 3-minute Japanese technique offers better results than jogging
description: Japanese researchers have unveiled an "Interval Walking Training" method, potentially burning more fat than jogging. This technique involves alternating three minutes of brisk walking with three minutes of slow walking for 30 minutes. This technique activates aerobic and anaerobic systems, triggers excess post exercise oxygen consumption and stimulates mitochondrial activity.

title: George Russell wins in Singapore as McLaren nabs constructors' title
description: Russell finished 5.43 seconds ahead of Red Bull's Verstappen

title: Misfiring Barcelona suffer 4-1 loss at Sevilla
description: Sevilla's first league win over Barcelona since 2015 provisionally lifted them to fourth in the table with 13 points from eight matches

title: Maria Sharapova’s comeback goes viral after shocking $78 racket restringing
description: Maria Sharapova made a surprising return to the tennis court in October 2025 after a two-year break, expressing shock over a $78 racket restringing fee. The 38-year-old, recently inducted into the Tennis Hall of Fame alongside Serena Williams, shared her experience on Instagram, questioning the high cost. Despite the expense, the five-time Grand Slam champion relished her comeback practice session.

title: Coldrif tragedy: Doctor held, SIT set up as Madhya Pradesh's 'syrup toll' rises to 14
description: Madhya Pradesh's cough syrup tragedy deepened as three more children died in Chhindwara, raising the toll to 14. A doctor was arrested for prescribing Coldrif, now banned after diethylene glycol was confirmed. An SIT is formed, and a child's body exhumed for autopsy. The manufacturer is also booked as eight children remain hospitalized, highlighting a grave public health crisis.

title: Valmiki: prime sage, premier poet
Horoscope Today, October 6, 2025: Astrological Insights for Scorpio, Gemini, Capricorn, Pisces, and Every Sun Sign
India-US trade talks: New Delhi's 'red lines' must be respected, says Jaishankar
description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar acknowledged "problems" in India-US trade relations, emphasizing India's non-negotiable "red lines" on farmers' interests. He called US tariffs, partly due to Russian oil purchases, "unfair." Despite trade hurdles, Jaishankar affirmed other aspects of the relationship and the Quad remain strong.

title: Haryana Congress leader Brijendra Singh embarks on Sadbhav Yatra” to revive social harmony against BJP’s divisive politics
description: Inspired by Rahul Gandhi’s Bharat Jodo Yatra, the yatra aims to carry forward the Congress’ vision and values directly to the people of Haryana and unify Congress workers and leaders

title: Bengal floods: 28 dead, dozens missing as rain ravages Darjeeling hills
description: Heavy overnight rain caused landslides and flooding in North Bengal. At least 28 people died, mostly in Mirik. Bridges collapsed, isolating towns and stranding tourists. Rescue operations are ongoing in affected areas. The Chief Minister announced immediate assistance. Rivers are flowing above danger levels. Animals fled submerged forests.

title: Mamata’s carnival push as north Bengal reels under floods gives Opposition a handle
description: Leaders from the BJP and CPI(M) raised question as to why the Chief Minister participated in the Durga Puja carnival on Sunday when north Bengal was reeling under floods. Ms. Banerjee will visit north Bengal on Monday

Punjab rolls out digital reforms in treasury, targets Rs 350 crore incentive in FY 2025-26
Karnataka: Lingayat is a separate religion, says CM Siddaramaiah
description: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah controversially declared Lingayat a separate religion, reigniting past allegations of community division. This statement comes amidst internal Lingayat confusion over identifying as a distinct religion or Hindu caste in ongoing surveys. While BJP urges Hindu caste identification, Congress promotes separate religious status.

description: “The new aircraft will be familiar and predictable to India, especially since they share the same engine and India observed the JF-17’s operational use during the May 2025 crisis”

title: India-EU ties: FTA talks today will seek to resolve key issues
description: Ahead of the 14th India-EU FTA talks, the EU highlighted challenging but crucial negotiations for a mutually beneficial deal. Despite no breakthrough in the last round, both sides are committed to resolving differences, aiming to unlock significant bilateral trade and investment potential, including an Investment Protection Agreement.

title: Russia condemns U.S. strike on alleged drug vessel near Venezuela
description: Four people were killed in the October 3 strike on the vessel which Washington accused of transporting "substantial amounts of narcotics headed to America to poison our people"

title: ‘I’ll stay in jail till there’s justice’: Wangchuk’s message from behind bars
description: Jailed climate activist Sonam Wangchuk demands a judicial inquiry into the Leh firing. Four people died and over 70 were wounded in the September 24 incident. Wangchuk remains in prison under NSA. He supports Ladakh's fight for statehood and Sixth Schedule status. Talks with the government are stalled until an inquiry happens. His wife challenges his arrest in Supreme Court.

Jeff Bezos makes a rare public appearance; says 'millions of people will live in space'
description: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos predicted millions will live in space within decades, driven by personal choice, with robots handling labor. He also envisioned gigawatt-scale AI data centers in orbit within 10-20 years, leveraging 24/7 solar power to outperform Earth-based facilities. Bezos called the AI investment surge a "good industrial bubble," expressing bullish optimism for the future.

title: Youngest billionaire on dropout life: Lucy Guo says parents disapproved; gives advice
description: Lucy Guo, 30, became a billionaire college dropout after her first company, Scale AI, was acquired by Meta for $29 billion. She left Carnegie Mellon early, opting for the Thiel Fellowship, a decision that initially disappointed her immigrant parents. Now founder of Passes, Guo still recognizes college's significant value for networking and forming lifelong connections.

title: Mark Kastelic charges at Rangers’ 6'9" Matt Rempe, refuses to flinch
description: Bruins' new forward Mark Kastelic charged Rangers' Matt Rempe in their final preseason game after both left the penalty box. This incident followed earlier physical plays and penalties, showcasing Kastelic's gritty character despite a significant size disadvantage. The fight, deemed a draw, highlighted Kastelic's readiness for tough bottom-six roles ahead of the Bruins' October 2025 season opener.

title: Elon Musk's SpaceX wins contracts worth $714 million from Pentagon
description: SpaceX secured five of seven critical US Space Force military launch missions for the upcoming fiscal year, totaling $714 million, reinforcing its dominance in Pentagon space contracts. United Launch Alliance received the remaining two missions. Blue Origin's New Glenn remains uncertified, missing out on this cycle's awards, though a NASA Mars mission could advance its prospects.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt questions wellness after Austin health experience
description: Kansas City Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt recently experienced an "eye-opening" holistic wellness assessment at Medici Health, Austin. This comprehensive check-up, spanning heart screenings to vision tests, profoundly highlighted the critical importance of proactive self-care before health issues emerge. Hunt lauded the compassionate team and the Phillips family's vision, advocating for health as a continuous, empowering journey for all.

title: Comet 3I/ATLAS races through solar system at 130,000 mph past Mars, Jupiter
description: An interstellar comet, 3I/ATLAS, is speeding through our solar system in 2025, marking only the third such visitor. Traveling at 130,000 mph, it will make close approaches to Mars and Jupiter, offering scientists a rare chance. ESA and NASA missions will observe its unique composition to unlock secrets of interstellar chemistry and planetary formation beyond our Sun.

title: Wayne Gretzky & Janet Jones’ love story: From dance fever to 30 years of marriage
description: Hockey legend Wayne Gretzky and Janet Jones' enduring love story began with a chance meeting in 1981, reigniting at a 1987 Lakers game. Their shared mindset led to a whirlwind romance, a "royal wedding" in 1988, and a family of five children. They prioritized family, making their decades-long marriage a true victory off the ice.
